image.altText: People move around below a blank sign in a Berlin airport

props.synopsis: Seemingly all at once, millions of computers around the world became unusable and unable to be rebooted, showing what's known in the industry as the "Blue Screen of Death".

title.children: How a bug in a little-known piece of software caused a global meltdown

image.altText: A woman holding a bunch of flowers.

props.synopsis: As industry experts continue to grapple with how a suspected defect in a computer update brought the world to a halt, Australians recount how the incident unfolded.

title.children: ‘Nothing like this has ever happened before’: Australians reflect on chaotic IT outage

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: Here's what we know about the IT outage affecting users around Australia and the world.

title.children: Australians have been hit by a worldwide tech outage. Here's what we know

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: Joe Biden is insistent on staying in the presidential race, despite a growing thrum of concern among senior Democrats who say he may not be able to defeat Donald Trump in the 2024 election.

title.children: Biden campaign insists he will stay in presidential race, amid growing calls to stand down

image.altText: An altered mugshot shows the mysterious Hamas military commander Mohammed Deif, who is known as The Guest.

props.synopsis: A leading Hamas military commander in Gaza has survived multiple Israeli attempts to kill him, but after a recent massive strike on what Israeli military said was a militant compound, they may have finally gotten their man — now all they need is evidence.

title.children: Israel thinks they've assassinated their No.1 enemy. Now all they need is proof that he's really dead

image.altText: a person wearing jackets walks on a snow-covered mountain at Ben Lomond National Park, Northern Tasmania.

props.synopsis: A cold front is forecast to bring hail, snow, rain and winds of up to 90 km/h, prompting a number of severe weather warnings from Adelaide to Victoria's north-eastern alps, and NSW's Illawarra region.

title.children: Hazardous weather across Australia's south-east to bring strong winds, hail, rain and snow

image.altText: JD Vance smiles, raises his left hand places his right hand over his heart as he walks out on a stage.

props.synopsis: The CFMEU's history gives us a window into Australia's economic, political and industrial landscape over the past 40 years.

title.children: The CFMEU's history is a window into Australia's industrial history — and it holds lessons for the next election

image.altText: Stacey and Nathaniel Train on their wedding day, with Nathaniel's brother Gareth.

props.synopsis: Background Briefing can reveal that Australia's first alleged Christian terrorists forged their fateful bond years ago following an explosive family rift.

title.children: Father reveals Wieambilla killers' shocking allegations years before deadly ambush

image.altText: The Crowdstrike logo, red and white with an eagle swooping down

props.synopsis: The global outage impacts a raft of Australian companies and government agencies. Here's the latest on the company reportedly responsible.

title.children: What is CrowdStrike, the American cybersecurity firm linked to today's global outage?

image.altText: A grinning Adelaide AFL player raises his thumbs above his head in celebration after a big goal.

props.synopsis: The Crows hit the front from a Josh Rachele goal with under a minute to go to beat the Bombers at Docklands in a Friday night thriller.

title.children: Rachele rescues the win for Adelaide as Bombers go down at Docklands

image.altText: A man in a suit surrounded by lights

props.synopsis: In a 92-minute speech, Donald Trump used Joe Biden's name only once, and asked a roaring crowd of party faithful to send him back to the White House. Meanwhile, the president endured another day of leaks and anonymous sources citing pressure for him to drop out of the race.

title.children: 'Blood everywhere': Trump describes shooting and Melania returns, as Republican Convention reaches crescendo

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: Rohan Cosgriff didn't tell anyone about a sextortion scam he had fallen victim to before taking his own life. A Victorian coroner says education needs to focus on breaking down the shame and guilt that prevents help-seeking.

title.children: Rohan took his own life within an hour of falling victim to a sextortion scam

image.altText: The inside of the International Court of Justice in The Hague

props.synopsis: The International Court of Justice rules that Israeli settlements in occupied Palestinian territories are illegal and all states should cooperate to bring an end to the Israel-Palestinian conflict, in an important advisory opinion issued on Friday.

title.children: Top UN court says Israeli settlements in occupied Palestinian territories are illegal

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Australian government agencies, retailers, banks and airlines call an emergency meeting after a widespread IT outage grounds flights, interrupts payment systems leaves and media outlets unable to operate.

title.children: 'No impact to critical infrastructure': Australian government holds snap crisis meeting over CrowdStrike outage

image.altText: A young man with a shaved head looks calm as he sits behind glass in a court dock wearing a blue checked shirt.

props.synopsis: Russian prosecutors alleged that Evan Gershkovich had gathered secret information on the orders of the CIA about a company that manufactures tanks for Moscow's war in Ukraine, allegations he and his employer denied.

title.children: Russian court jails Wall Street Journal reporter for 16 years after convicting him of espionage

image.altText: Stills of video which played a role in the Australian's four month investigation

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) discontinues its investigation into "white hands on black art" allegations at the APY Arts Centre Collective (APY CCC), saying it has found nothing to suggest consumer law has been breached.

title.children: ACCC finds no consumer law breached in 'white hands on black art' allegations

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn will appeal his murder conviction, his lawyer says, after he was found guilty of killing retiree Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: Media reports about Greg Lynn have 'poisoned the well of justice', lawyer tells court

image.altText: Chanel Harris-Tavita runs with the ball and his grabbed by a Canberra Raiders defender during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: An injury to first-choice kicker Adam Pompey costs the Warriors dearly as Chanel Harris-Tavita misses a shot to equalise from right next to the posts in the dying minutes in Canberra.

title.children: 'He should have thrown it over': Woeful missed conversion costs Warriors the game in Canberra

image.altText: Commuters stand on a suburban train in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: It's so frustrating — your phone shows full bars of signal strength but it can't upload photos to Instagram or play Netflix or TikTok, let alone send emails or jump into a video conference.

title.children: Why you might find yourself struggling for phone connection in the heart of the city

image.altText: Orange scooters parked on a CBD street on a grey overcast day.

props.synopsis: E-scooters will be permanently legalised across Victoria from October, when a range of safety and compliance measures roll out including tougher fines for those not following the rules.

title.children: Share hire e-scooters will be permanently legalised across Victoria following a two-year trial

image.altText: A doll house, clapping sticks and an aboriginal flag design puzzle

props.synopsis: Program leaders say allowing Aboriginal people to take control of decision making for Aboriginal children in out-of-home care is improving rates of family reunification.

title.children: Victorian program reunites Aboriginal children and families by giving cultural organisations the power to make decisions

image.altText: Nuclear and Canada picture

props.synopsis: Canadian experts say it's not too late for Australia to build a nuclear power industry. But should we?

title.children: What Australia can learn from Canada's nuclear power industry

image.altText: A street view with three wall-to-wall stone homes with large arched windows and cafes and shops downstairs

props.synopsis: Comic artist Jo Waite has spent her adult life renting and squatting in Melbourne's inner suburbs, watching gentrification unfold in real time. Now, she is drawing her old homes one by one — but the beauty of the grand homes hides the reality of life inside them for tenants in decades past.

title.children: Jo rented and squatted in the grand old homes of inner Melbourne for years. When they became unaffordable, she started drawing them instead

image.altText: A closeup shot of the prime minister looking sombre, wearing glasses and frowning

props.synopsis: No doubt the administrators will clean out the CFMEU. But you'd be an optimist to feel confident that one collection of bad applies won't eventually be replaced by another.

title.children: The bad apples at the CFMEU are on the way out. The next crop deserves close attention

image.altText: Hacking

props.synopsis: eScripts provider MediSecure has revealed 12.9 million Australians had personal data stolen in a cyber breach earlier this year, making it one of the largest data hacks in Australian history.

title.children: MediSecure 'not in a financial position' to identify 12.9m Australians who had data stolen

image.altText: A factory fire

props.synopsis: A large factory fire in Melbourne's west, which killed two men earlier this year, was allegedly ordered by a prisoner for a fee of $4,000.

title.children: Jail inmate allegedly hired teens to start deadly factory fire, court hears

image.altText: Kimberley Lee smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Ask Kimberley Lee if she would like to find her birth mother and she will admit that until recently the answer was almost always "no".

title.children: For Kimberley, opening her DNA test results was like opening 'a can of worms'

image.altText: A large outside view of a compound

props.synopsis: The number of refugees being held on Nauru has increased sixfold in six months, even though the centre was empty at one stage last year.

title.children: Offshore detention numbers increase sixfold as advocates slam policy as 'financial and moral vacuum'

image.altText: A teenage boy sits on a step drinking Fanta next to a young girl who looks away from him to the right.

props.synopsis: A delightful mockumentary that underscores the universality of childhood grandiosity and imagination, plus seven feature films by Black filmmakers to catch at the very first Africa Film Fest Australia this weekend.

title.children: 'Everyday I drink two Fantas': Black boyhood is in the spotlight at this inaugural African film festival

image.altText: A man standing near sunflowers out the front of his suburban home.

props.synopsis: Home ownership is a cornerstone of the Australian dream — but for many it feels increasingly out of reach.

title.children: Donggang's home has doubled in value since he bought — but he's not happy about it

image.altText: a man wearing glasses standing outdoors in front of a media pack

props.synopsis: The former NSW Liberal leader, who was the state's premier from October 2021 to March 2023, announces his resignation from politics and will head up BHP's office in Washignton DC.

title.children: Perrottet lands plum job in US after announcing end of his political career

image.altText: A blonde white woman wearing a pink suit raises her hands in celebration and smiles

props.synopsis: The German former defence minister outlined the climate crisis and European Union defence cooperation as the focus for her five-year term.

title.children: Von der Leyen pledges strong defence union and green transition in new EU term

image.altText: Two police officers are in uniform with their faces blurred out. In the background are houses and empty land

props.synopsis: Police are ordered to reinvestigate allegations they used unreasonable force against kids during a shopping centre scuffle.

title.children: Watch this police officer's response when he's asked, 'How many Black kids are you going to assault?'
